data.title: Alchetron, The Free Social Encyclopedia
data.meta_description: Roger Birnbaum (born c. 1950) is an American film producer who owns the company Spyglass Entertainment and was coCEO and coChairman of MetroGoldwynMayer. His two greatest box office hits as producer have been Rush Hour 2 and The Tourist which grossed US347,325,802 and US278,346,189 at the worl
data.text:
Biography

Birnbaum was born to a Jewish family in Teaneck, New Jersey, the son of Arlene (n√©e Steinlauf) and Norman Birnbaum. His father was a World War II veteran who went into the embroidery business with his father after the war and used his profits in 1967 to build the Stonehenge a building in New Jersey. Birnbaum graduated from Teaneck High School and attended the University of Denver.

Personal life

His first wife was Pamela West; they had one daughter Claire Birnbaum Block (born 1987). He later married Leslie Lopez.
